page.title: 01Sway, Bashley and Tiptoe.
page.content: These villages are situated on the edge of the New Forest. Sway is the largest and is developing as new housing fills plots of available land. Bashley and Tiptoe are linear types of village following the main routes. A large proportion of the land is given over to agriculture. Farms in the area concentrate on animal husbandry; cattle and sheep, and turkey breeding. Market gardening, particularly crops grown under glass, is important in this area. The major income for the area comes from tourism e.g. Bashley Caravan Park. The main Waterloo to Bournemouth railway line passes diagonally through the area.
